message:
Hello a few things,
Currently, the app does not seem to support separate profiles for different roles in a clear manner. When registering as a handyman, I am forced to choose a “Provider” profile, which appears to tie me to a company. This restriction raises several questions:
... Why can’t freelance handymen use the app independently?
... What is the rationale behind mandatorry linking handymen to a company profile?
Supporting independent handymen could significantly expand the app’s user base and appeal. Freelance workers often operate without being tied to a company, and the app should cater to their needs by offering a dedicated profile type for them, with dedicated app section.Feature Suggestions:
1. Custom Service Subscriptions:
- Allow both company and handyman profiles to subscribe to specific service categories and set a radius for receiving job notifications. This would help users focus on relevant opportunities while enhancing user experience.2. Custom Job Posting Section:
- Introduce a dedicated section in the app where users and guest users can view custom job requests posted by clients. This feature would encourage more individuals to create handyman profiles and take up jobs in their area, especially if they match their skills and availability.3. Pricing Plans:
The current plans feel underwhelming. Consider adding features that improve value for users, such as:
... Limiting the number of bookings based on the plan tier.
... Limiting the number of service categories on which ones is subscribed based on the plan tier.
... Restricting the number of total services that can be configured for lower-tier plans.
... Admin commissions or lower additional fees for higher-tier plans with more capabilities.Can this be implemented, and if so, can you contact me for a quote ?

responses.message: Thank you for your detailed feedback and suggestions. We understand the importance of supporting independent handymen and enhancing the app’s features to provide a more inclusive and flexible experience.1) Independent Handyman Support:We agree that enabling freelance handymen to use the app independently would significantly broaden its appeal. We will include the option for a dedicated handyman profile in our future roadmap. This profile will not require linking to a company, ensuring flexibility for freelancers.2) Custom Service Subscriptions:Allowing subscription to specific service categories and setting a radius for job notifications is a fantastic idea. We will explore the feasibility and add it to our roadmap. For Custom Job Posting Section, A dedicated section for viewing and responding to custom job requests is valuable for connecting clients and handymen. We will include this in our roadmap and consider its implementation.3) Pricing Plan Enhancements:Your suggestions on improving pricing plans (e.g., limiting bookings, service categories, and additional fees) are excellent. We’ll analyze how to integrate these features to make plans more compelling.We will include these suggestions in our development roadmap. If you require these features urgently, we can provide a customized solution. Please let us know, and we’ll contact you to discuss the quote and timeline for implementation.Thank you again for sharing these valuable insights!

However, if you require automatic processing through Stripe, we can customize your project to include this feature. Please let us know your preferences!Thank you.

We use RazorpayX and Stripe in the backend for withdrawing funds for users and providers from the wallet. To enable this, go to the Payment Configuration tab under the Settings section.Currently, only provider withdrawal requests are supported, not for users. However, adding this feature is possible through customization. If you’d like to implement it, we can assist with customization.Thank you!

responses.message: Thank you for your suggestion. While we do provide a delete functionality for bookings in the admin panel, we do not allow users to delete bookings. This restriction ensures users cannot remove booking records at any time, which could lead to inconsistencies. Instead, users have the option to cancel a booking if it has not yet been accepted. This approach ensures proper tracking and accountability for all booking attempts while still giving admins the flexibility to manage bookings as needed.

Mate, Booking attempt show up in the booking list as soon as the user confirm the booking even before making the advance payment. that means if user go back to the previous screen or close minimize the app. that booking is in the list with a “Waiting” status.  there’s no cancel option when the status is waiting. users will test the app continuously without completing payment and all thos booking will just show up in the boking list and might look confuse to usersalso if user already has a booking with waiting status then users shouldn’t be able to book that service until he/she have a status for that service that is either canceled, complete, ongoing.  should have a mechanism that prevent abuse from people with malicious intention.the can add delete option for users, but only for booking with waiting status however the delete button should be remove once the status is adjusted. (that mean the user has paid for that particualar service.

Thank you for your feedback and detailed explanation. Currently, we do not allow users to delete bookings in any status. However, if this feature aligns with our application flow, we can consider adding it to our roadmap to enable users to delete bookings with a “Waiting” status in the future. If you require this functionality urgently, we can customize it for you.

message:
dynamically generated using Laravel. These pages should be:1,SEO-optimized (custom meta title, description, and content).
2,Editable via a Laravel-based admin panel.
3,Automatically mapped to URLs like /services/Azadpur or /services/delhi.Column Name      Data Type    Description1,id                                 INT              Primary Key
2,name          VARCHAR           Name of the city or area (e.g., Azadpur, Delhi).
3,type                     ENUM             Specifies whether it’s a city or area.
4,slug                     VARCHAR    Unique, URL-friendly identifier (e.g., Azadpur).
5,description              TEXT               Location-specific content.
6,meta_title             VARCHAR       SEO meta title.
7,meta_description     TEXT               SEO meta description.
8,created_at             TIMESTAMP        Timestamp of creation.
9,updated_at             TIMESTAMP        Timestamp of last update.Additional Features for SEO1,Dynamic Meta Tags: Use meta_title and meta_description for each page.
2,Breadcrumbs: Add breadcrumbs for navigation (e.g., Home > Services > Azadpur).
3,Structured Data: Use LocalBusiness Schema

One Suggestion Team,We propose adding a “Vacation Mode” switch to the provider app. This feature would:Enhance User Awareness: Clearly communicate the provider's availability status to users.
Prevent Unintended Bookings: Disable booking functionality for services offered by providers in "Vacation Mode." 
Provide Clear Guidance: Display a user-friendly message ("Provider on Vacation, please book with another provider") and direct users to a relevant category page within the app.This feature would improve the user experience by preventing frustrating situations for both users and providers.Thank you for your consideration.

responses.message: Hello,1) For single providers, multiple service addresses can be added. This allows users to book services in the specified service areas where the provider operates. message: interesting update .. finally laravel 11 .. hmm im gonna test it now and let you know thanks

1. Does this app support escrow payment where by the admin
holds payment for service provider until when the customer
confirms that the work or service has been provided, to 
avoid service providers taking money from customers and 
don’t offer service?2. Does this app support manual approval of services providers
where by the admin first orient and verify service providers before
their account start to recieve task, to allow admin activate only
approved service providers?3. Does this app support feature for organizations register on the app
and add their service providers each time task is assigned to this
company the company or customer can choose from services providers 
or experts of this company4. How does the admin make money does the admin charge subscription
by customers and service providers or charge either customer or service
provider per task assigned, please describe for me how admin generate
revenue?5. Does this app allow customers book and pay service providers not hours
but days or pay per day for example customer can hire service provider
for days and pay one sum per day not per hours?6. What is the difference between provider and handy man?Thank you

responses.message: 1. No, we do not currently provide an escrow system. However, the money is sent to the provider only after the admin transfers it, following the user’s confirmation.2. Yes, the app supports manual approval for service providers. Admins can verify and approve service providers before their accounts become active. Once approved, providers can log in to their dashboard, add services, and start receiving tasks.3. Yes, a provider can operate as a company and add their experts as handymen. When a service request is received, the provider can choose to assign the task either to themselves or to one of their handymen4. If your earning model is commission-based, the admin earns a percentage from each service. For example, if the provider’s commission is set to 80%, the provider receives 80% of the service fee, while the remaining 20% goes to the admin.If the earning model is subscription-based, providers must purchase a subscription plan to offer their services and receive tasks. The earnings for the admin come from the subscription fees paid by the providers, which serve as the admin’s revenue for accessing the platform and using its features.5. Currently, the app does not support the feature for customers to book and pay service providers per day, instead of per hour. This would require some modifications to the platform .6. The difference between a provider and a handyman is as follows:Provider: The provider is the main entity or business, typically a company or individual that can add services to the platform, receive direct booking requests from customers, and manage their own operations. Providers can set up their profile, list the services they offer, and handle the entire booking process. They are the primary point of contact for customers and can assign tasks to handymen working under them.Handyman: A handyman is a person who works under a provider but does not have the ability to list services or receive direct service requests from customers. They are assigned tasks by the provider based on the service requests that the provider receives. Handymen can perform the work, but they do not have the authority to manage their own bookings or services within the platform.
Ok thank you so much
Let us know if you have further questions—we’re happy to assist!

1.I’m curious about the “New: Default Advance Payment Module”  is it like a wallet system with auto deduction /increase commission feature including cash/wallet points/ and other payment method or it’s something else ?

2. And Also “Cancellation Charge Module” is it towards both provider and customers? please provide the flow of it

1. Default Advance Payment Module
Here’s how it works:- Default Setting: The module allows you to set a default advance payment amount under Settings > Service Configuration.- Application: This default advance payment is automatically applied to fixed-price services when their advance payment amount is not specified during service creation.- Payment Methods: Customers can pay the advance amount via a wallet, or other online available payment methods.2. Cancellation Charge Module
The Cancellation Charge Module applies only to customers and works as follows:- Configuration: Cancellation charges and applicable time limits are set under Settings > Service Configuration.- If a customer cancels a booking within the configured time frame (before the set hours), the cancellation charge is applied.- If the cancellation occurs after the defined hours, no cancellation charge is imposed.- If the provider cancels or rejects the booking, no cancellation charges are applied to the customer.

    – mpdf/mpdf v8.2.5 requires ext-gd * -> it is missing from your system. Install or enable PHP’s gd extension.To enable extensions, verify that they are enabled in your .ini files:

message:
Hi, there,
first of all, I’d like to point out that the application is very well done, but there are a number of bugs that need to be corrected (I almost took the Edemandium application from one of your competitors here, but I said to myself, “I’d better invest in something that’s well advanced!Validations and requests are too slow!!! it takes several seconds or even minutes for this to happen! and I have a big server and high bandwidth. (this is very problematic).*_ Mobile version _1. Messages1.1 Instant messaging (when the user is in off-client or handyman mode, you can’t send messages)
1.1.1 Messaging, images and photos cannot be sent.
1.1.2 Not instant messaging  
1.1.3 messages cannot be deleted2. Payments2.1 Offline payment works, but the do-it-yourselfer or supplier can’t validate, nothing happens!
2.1 When paying either by card or offline, the system asks for payment a 2nd time! perhaps a syncro problem due to the slowness of the system.  
2.2 Payments on the web version don’t work either, the customer has no way to do it, he has to go through the mobile application.
2.3 Offline payments for subscriptions (cheques, transfers, cash) really need to be made available – some supplier customers want this method of payment.Other functions- The request for work, it works, the customer can send his request, but nothing happens afterwards, I see it in the admin in the list that’s all, what to do? we have no way of processing this request or assigning it to a supplier … and the customer is waiting for an answer.- We receive notifications, but there’s nothing in the history!- We receive notifications, but there’s nothing in the history!
- Roles & permissions, you really need to check all this, for example for suppliers, normally they can’t write a blog, it’s unchecked in the admin and yet I can create a blog.- On the Web versions (admin, provider, handyman, customer) you can’t intervene in the service, you can’t start the work, you can’t finalize it, you can’t pay, you can’t rate, nothing! you can just book and basta. it’s very frustrating.
- Very slow, even on the WEB version.- Don’t forget to add Ads for providers with ad purchases (like your competitor Edemandium), a very practical feature.
- We also need to work on website ergonomics, provider panel, handyman and especially admin (not very fluid).- Remember to save deleted profiles and keep them for a while (30 days or more) for greater security with triggers in the database.- Remember to translate all fields, including notifications, categories, sub-categories, etc. It’s complicated on the application to have several languages in the same service.I’m not going to add any more bugs related to the admin or the panels (suppliers, handymen), I think you know them.Thank you for taking my comments into consideration, I think the application is promising and it’s a shame I’m taking on your competitor, I know it’s a lot of work.Thank you for your efforts. *

message:
1)Admin Login – Add New Handyman page – “Handyman type” dropdown is NOT available(it’s avilable in your demo youtube video)
Does this mean freelance handymen cannot be added to the system ?2) Can Handyman be registered without a provider ? (Individual people)3) Registered with new handyman from your demo provider app. Received 500 internal server error.4) does your app support multi currency ?5) Can you please explain the maths here ? If Handyman finish a $100 job,
lets say provider commistion is 70%
and
Handyman commision is 60%
How much does handyman get ?
How much does provider get ?
How much does Admin(I) get ?

responses.message:
1. Yes, we support freelance handymen! In our system, we simply renamed “Handyman Type” to “Handyman Commission” for clarity. 
You can refer to this screenshot for more details:https://prnt.sc/_apG6D7Ebq8z2. A Handyman can sign up without needing a provider, but they can’t start offering services until they are connected to a provider. A provider acts as someone who oversees the Handyman’s work. On the other hand, a provider can work independently, just like a Handyman.3. Thank you for pointing out the error encountered during registration in the demo provider app. We’re looking into this issue and will address it.4. Currently, the system doesn’t support multi-currency. However, you can set a default currency in Settings > Site Setup > Default Currency if needed. Here’s how it looks:https://prnt.sc/uIb4W56GX1kx5. Here’s the breakdown for a $100 job with the commissions specified:Admin: $30
Provider: $28
Handyman: $42

So basically individual person cannot register without a provider and offer services right ?That’s a blocker issue. Because I expected Individual person to be able to register, offer services and get paid without a provider.Example: Individual plumber might not have a provider

If you’re an individual offering services independently, you can register as a provider. This allows you to manage and assign work directly to yourself, so you can provide services and receive payments without needing a separate provider.

message:
Pre-purchase question.
We are a bit confused around the difference between a ‘provider’ and a ‘handyman’.Example:
If someone signs up as a plumber or an electrician or a cleaning company.
How do you categorize them?
To us, a provider is the same person providing the service (plumbing, fixing the light, or cleaning the apartment).Also, does the admin have to ‘physically/manually’ confirm from the backend?
Or when someone looking for a cleaner finds the cleaner and submits the request,
Or does the user just submits a general request to the platform and the closest provider gets notified and they can choose to accept the service or not?We are hoping that there is ‘less manual work’ and ‘more automated’ bookings between the user (general public) and the provider (cleaning company, handyman, plumber, etc).More:
Under “cleaning” there could be dozens for ‘providers’, each from a different company.
Under “handyman” we can also have dozens of ‘providers’ which are also different companies that offer a ‘specific service’, like some handyman might do plumbing and wiring, others might just do painting and drywall.This how we are imagining it: 
Admin/Owner/Platform – we own the app and the platform/website
Providers – Handyman, Cleaning, Plumber, Interior Designer, Painter, etc.
Customer – Anyone looking to have a service performed/done (general public, friends, grandma, etc.)But we are still a bit confused around the difference between a ‘provider’ and a ‘handyman’.Thanks!

responses.message: Sorry for late reply as we were on holiday for Diwali festival.1) Difference between a ‘provider’ and a ‘handyman’.Provider: Represents a company or organization that offers various services, such as cleaning, plumbing, or electrical work. Each provider can manage multiple handymen who perform the actual services.Handyman: Refers to individual service providers who work under a provider. They directly deliver services and specialize in specific areas like plumbing, electrical work, or cleaning.2) No, the admin cannot manually update bookings from the backend, but this functionality can be implemented through customization.3) Yes, we offer a post job request feature in our system. If a user cannot find a particular service on our platform, they can post a custom service job request. Once posted, nearby providers will be notified and can bid on the specific job request.4) Yes, our booking process allows users to book a specific service. Once a provider is notified, they can accept or cancel the request. If accepted, the provider can assign the job to themselves or their handyman, after which the user can start and complete the service.5) No, in our platform, each service is linked to a single provider. However, a provider can offer multiple services and manage multiple handymen.

We’re still confused.We currently have Directory site where plumbers, electricians, painters, cleaners, etc. can signup their business to provide a service. They own their own company, they are not our employees. They provide the service (Service Providers)If someone needs an electrician, they post a request, which any ‘service provider’ within that sector can reply to or bid on.Payment are made between the person paying for the request, in this case we can call them ‘general public’, and the Service Provider.Example1 :
I come to CodeCanyon to but source code, for someone like you. The ‘provider’.
If I need extra work down I would hire a developer, the ‘handyman’.
The ‘handyman’ does not necessarily work under you, he’s just a developer, for anywhere that I want to hire for the task.Example 2:Company name: ABC Plumbing (1 of 100 companies)Number of employees: 1Sector/Category: PlumbingNumber of companies in plumbing sector/category: 100

As per the example 1 there is one clarification from our side.You come on to Codecanyon and find a service from us. Now for customization requirements someone(handyman) from our company will be assigned for customization.Handymen cannot directly provide service. Handynan will be assigned to at least one provider. And the provider will assign the work to the handyman.This is our existing scenario.You want an individual handyman to work like a provider independently.Correct me if I’ve misunderstood your requirements.

message:
Hello, So after the handyman collects cash payment, how does  the admin collect their commission?
Is there a setting of the accumulated commission threshold that the handyman cannot exceed that must be paid to admin before they can take more tasks?

responses.message: If a customer pays in cash, the payment is handled manually, but it will be recorded as a cash payment. The handyman will collect the cash from the customer, send it to the provider, who will then forward it to the admin. The admin will handle all commission as online payment.Currently, we don’t have settings for this, but we can customize your code to meet your requirements.

message: Hello,Once the service is ended by the customer, now to service waiting Pending for approval, but there is no option to change the status from handyman and provider interface, could you please help me with this.

responses.message: Once the customer finishes the service, only the provider or handyman can mark it as ‘Completed.’ This ensures that any additional charges can be added before finalizing the service status. Please note that this feature is available on the app side only and is not supported on the handyman or provider web platforms.
Okay, When customer books a service, there is no assign option for the provider in demo application, service is automatically self assigned, How can I assign service to other handyman?

In the demo application, when a customer books a service, it is automatically assigned to the provider due to the configuration set in the admin panel. Specifically, under Settings -> App Configuration, the Enable Auto-Assign option is turned on. This causes the system to automatically assign the service to the provider.If you want to manually assign the service to a handyman, simply turn off the Auto-Assign feature in the admin panel. Once it’s disabled, you’ll have the option to manually assign services to the appropriate handyman.

message: Hey there, I hope all is well. These updates are crucial for ensuring the platform runs smoothly and meets user needs. With these additions and fixes, we can provide a much better experience for both the providers and the customers. Please make sure these are all included in the next update, as they will significantly impact our operations.Add Products to Booking: The most important feature is the ability for users to add products like cement, hair dye, or bricks to their booking. This way, the handyman can bring the necessary materials right away. Please prioritize this as it’s critical for streamlining the service.Delivery and Ambulance Feature: Please also include the delivery and ambulance service feature that we’ve discussed before.Fixing Bugs & Handyman Errors: Make sure all the bugs and inconsistencies I reported and confirmed with Nimesh B. are addressed in this update, especially the issues in the handyman module. These are preventing a smooth boot and need to be resolved as a priority.Commission System: Please confirm that the commission setup will be updated so that the provider has control over setting the commission for their handyman. Since it’s their deal with the handyman, it makes sense for the provider to manage this. However, the admin should still be able to set a default platform commission, and the provider can then distribute the remainder accordingly.Service at Business Premises: Also, can you confirm that the “Service at Business Premises” feature (similar to a kiosk setup) will be included in this update? It’s important for those offering services at both home and business locations.Admin Management & Status Change: The admin should have more control over managing orders—such as editing prices, handling cancellations, and changing service statuses without needing client approval. This will streamline operations significantly, so please make sure it’s included in the update.Coupon Management: The coupon management system needs to be streamlined by adding an “ALL” option, so we don’t have to spend 20 minutes scrolling through endless options. This will make it much easier to manage multiple coupons.Customization, UI Enhancements & Admin Footer: I also like the idea of adding TinyMC for rich-text formatting in service details and improving admin panel customization (like adding a HEX code color changer). Additionally, please remove or make it possible to edit your name on the admin panel footer. It’s important that our employees don’t see “Iqonic” displayed there.Subscription-Based Services: It would be great to include a feature where users can subscribe to recurring services (e.g., weekly room cleaning for one month). This would improve convenience for customers and boost engagement with repeat services.Multiple Service Bookings: Please implement the ability for users to book multiple services in one order. This will make the booking process more efficient and save customers time.Please confirm that all of these points will be taken care of in this upcoming update, especially the ability for the provider to set their own commissions and the service kiosk feature.Thanks! Looking forward to the release.

If the provider commission is set at 10% and the handyman commission is 10%, the admin automatically gets 80%.- Provider Commission:https://prnt.sc/j0swq3sWVpFI- Handyman Commission:https://prnt.sc/cLonmei_EduR- Cash Flow Explanation: Handyman submit full payment to providers. This ensures all payments and transactions are securely processed and tracked.

message:
1) How can a user make multiple service booking under 1 order?
2) No Option for Admin to edit the order, if a customer need to make changes. Like Price, order Cancellation etc. Admin Cant Manage the order.
3) In Provider App there is no option for Provider to Make Payment to handyman.
4) Cash Flow:
Suppose Service Amount is 100.
Admin will get 10%, Provider will get 10%, Handyman will get 80%.
What will be the Commision rates to be SET.After Collecting Cash from Customer. Why Handyman have to submit full 100% money to provider. why he cant just submit 20%. Then Provider will submit 10% to admin.Why first payment should send to provider First then Admin. Then again Admin will pay to provider, Then provider will pay to Handymen. (This is Quite Confusing).

responses.message: Hi karan,1) In the user app, a user can’t book multiple services in a single order but can book services with add-ons or service packages:- Add-ons: Users can select additional services during booking.- Service Packages: Users can book packages that include multiple services, found in the service details.2) Only users and providers can manage bookings in their respective apps User App and Provider App. Admins can only delete or assign bookings to handymen.3) Currently, there’s no option for providers to make payments to handymen in the app, but we’ve added this suggestion to our roadmap for future updates.4) For commission setup:- Admin sets commission for both providers and handymen via the admin panel. If the provider commission is set at 10% and the handyman commission is 10%, the admin automatically gets 80%.- Provider Commission:https://prnt.sc/j0swq3sWVpFI- Handyman Commission:https://prnt.sc/cLonmei_EduR- Cash Flow Explanation: Handyman submit full payment to providers. Providers submit to admin. Admin keeps their commission and pass on the remaining amount to the providers. Then providers keep their commission and pay to the handyman. This ensures all payments and transactions are securely processed and tracked.

message:
Hello team, I am reviewing your script and it seems to be a very complete script and works all its functions correctly. But the icing on the cake is missing.I put you in context so you understand better: Imagine that you want to buy a horror book and you go to a bookstore to buy one.The problem is that all the books are the same color with the same design and the same title and only the name of the autor changes.How do you know which will be a good book for you? The same goes for the list of service providers shown here.Nobody stands out for their work or their level. This means that you have to add functions that highlight each service provider, such as these:1.- Level of seller
(Bronze, Silver, Gold, Diamond) Each level must meet a series of requirements such as number of sales or number of ratings…2.- Verified seller. 
When you send your documentation and pass an interview with the administrator.3.-Antique. 
For example New or 2 months3.- Productivity. 
Total services completed4.- Review
Stars 4.5 (17)5.- Chat. 
be able to contact the service provider before booking. Some points need to be clarified————————
All this information must go on the service provider’s card in the grip type list. The same information must also be included on the service provider’s page and this following information must also be includedTo the previous list you have to add- Gallery. 
Here show photos of the services performed- Information of interest about me. 
Here you must list all the points that the provider considers with a maximum of 10 items.Next:
Here we must add 3 sections that comply with the law and give the client a guarantee to be able to use the platform.Sections:- Level. 
Here you have to put the badge and just below it the detailed description.- Platform guarantee 
Here we must explain the guarantee and insurance that the platform offers to the client.- Frequently asked questions.- Cancellation policies- Customer support
—————————————Service provider appCurrently the system allows us to respond to a client’s request for quotes.If the client contacts the service provider by chat and needs a personalized service with a personalized price, the service provider has no way to send it so that the commercial operation is registered in the system.//////////////////::::::::::::::::::::::;:You could consider this in your next update including zone assignment. message: can you please explained how timely service booking works? thank you i can not find it on your support faq

responses.message:
1.Service Selection:User Chooses a Service: The process begins when a user selects a specific service they want to book. This could be anything from a salon appointment, a consultation, or a repair service.Service Details: The user may see details about the service, including duration, price, and description.2.Time Slot Availability:Fetching Available Time Slots: After the service is selected, the system checks for available time slots. These time slots are determined based on:Service Provider’s Schedule: The working hours of the service provider or business.Existing Bookings: Any slots that have already been booked by other users are excluded from availability.Displaying Time Slots: The available time slots are presented to the user, typically in a calendar or list format. The user can see which times are free and select the one that best fits their schedule.3.User Books a Time Slot:Selecting a Time Slot: The user selects a preferred time slot from the available options.User Information: The user may be required to provide personal information (e.g., name, contact details) to complete the booking.Payment (If Required): If the service requires payment, the user might be prompted to pay online during the booking process.4.Confirmation:Booking Confirmation: Once the user completes the booking process, the system sends a confirmation to the user. This usually includes details like:- Service name
- Selected time slot
- Location (if applicable)
- Any special instructions or requirementsNotification to Service Provider: The service provider is also notified about the booking, ensuring they are prepared for the appointment.

responses.message: Could you clarify your question or specify which technical areas you’d like more information about?

Some of questions:TRANSLATION : Is it possible to add new or/and edit current translation from the Laravel directly or in Flutter only? If there is only code-wise translation is possible, where we can get files for translation, to review them prior to purchase?Same questions for Laravel backend.DESIGN & COLORS: I need total rewamp of design and colors, that is also possible only from Flutter source or you have option to change look and feel of apps from Laravel backend?EXTENDED LICENSE: How long implementation process takes (from purchase to ready-apps on stores and server)? What is included within scope of this license?RESPONDING TIME: At the moment your respond/reply time to my questions is, well – not so good to be honest, I am not satisified if that is the way how you communicate – I am not sure can we align together in this project

TRANSLATION: Our application currently supports code-wise translations, which can be managed within the Flutter source code. We are using an Excel sheet where all text entries and their corresponding translations are recorded, making it easier for you to review and modify translations before purchase.DESIGN & COLORS: To implement a full revamp of the design and colors in your app, this change would need to be done primarily on the Flutter side, as the frontend (UI/UX) is handled by the Flutter code. The Laravel backend typically handles the business logic, API endpoints, and data management, but it doesn’t directly influence the app’s design unless you build in customization features.EXTENDED LICENSE: We need 16-18 days to complete installation service. We will upload your website to your hosting server, upload Provider/Customer app on play store and app store including your branding on your developer accounts on both stores.RESPONDING TIME: We will communicate on Skype once you buy extended license to get quick replies from you.Let us know if you still have any query.

message: I’m currently exploring apps with features similar to yours and have a few specific requirements. Could you please let me know if your app supports or can accommodate the following:1. Is it possible to remove all payment features from the app, so that it functions solely as a platform to connect buyers with service providers? message:
Hi I have gone through your app but failed to understand how admin can get commission on cash paymentsExample You want to implement a service fee system where providers pay a 10% ,like after order provider gets 100 he should be able to send only $10 commission to admin of which of not paid he can get a job next timeI also noticed on online service there is no option for video chat with client 
Do you have plans to add this featureI want to purchase this code I just need to understand these

responses.message: When a provider receives a cash payment from a user, they manually send this amount to the admin via cash or admin’s bank account. Once the admin confirms the payment, they update their earnings to reflect the transaction as an online payment.In online payments, transactions are directly deposited into the admin’s bank account,eliminating this issue.However, with cash payments, we encounter a problem. To address it, we provide three options:- Admin can turn off cash payments.- Set services as advance payment only.- Block the provider from the system.we will provide a video chat option in our online service. Please wait for our future updates.

message: I bought the PHP script a year ago, and with each update, I am obligated to hire a developer to make edits to the source code to meet iOS requirements. After updating to the latest version, the Apple Store has requested a report button in the chat because the provider or the user may talk rudely to each other. They require this button for the new version to be accepted, along with the Apple ID sign-in. Developers of this script should be more careful with iOS updates.

responses.message: We understand the importance of staying compliant with the latest iOS requirements. We apologize for any inconvenience this has caused.We are actively working on adding a “Report” button in the chat feature to address issues of inappropriate communication between users and providers. This will ensure that the app meets the necessary guidelines for the Apple Store.These features will be included in a future update, and we will notify you as soon as they are available. We appreciate your patience and understanding as we strive to improve our product to meet your needs.

message: Missing very important feature regarding the cancellation!I just Find out the customer can cancel the order even after it started and get full refund!! which is not logic at all!This should have cancellation rules, which can be managed by admin or by admin and provider.

responses.message: Hello, We understand the importance of ensuring fair cancellation policies for both customers and service providers. Rest assured, our system is designed to prevent customers from initiating cancellations once a service has begun. Once the status of a booking changes to “ongoing” or beyond, the cancel button will no longer be visible to the customer. This ensures that cancellations are only permitted under appropriate circumstances.Thnak you.
Even after status “on going”, the customer can Pause the order, then cancel it. and full refund going back to customer!
Understood, we’ve noted the issue and will address it in future updates.

message: just few questions: 1.is there any way to add the ‘quote’ feature so the provider can quote a job? 2. I dont need most of the buy/sell features is there any way to hide/remove them?

responses.message: Hello, Thank you for reaching out.1 – In our customer app, we have a feature called “Custom Job Request” that closely aligns with what you’re looking for.This feature comes into play when users need a service that isn’t already listed in the application. It also provides an opportunity for service providers to explore new avenues for their business.With “Custom Job Request,” users can simply add the service they require directly from the Customer app. Once posted, all available service providers will be able to view these requests and submit their bids accordingly. Users can then review these bids and select the one that best suits their needs.This way, users have the flexibility to request specific services tailored to their needs, while service providers have the opportunity to offer their expertise beyond the predefined services listed in the app. It’s a win-win situation for both parties!2 – You can remove specific functionalities or features from the codebase by letting us know exactly what you want to remove or hide. Once we have a clear understanding of your requirements, we can provide precise guidance on how to proceed.

1. basically the custom job request is the only one feature I need for the customer.
example:
customer:
painting & decorating -> qualification: 3 walls & ceiling
how it can become the define service?Question: if I have 1000 painters in the area given will it notify all 1000?2. basically I don’t need any wallet or money transfer elements.
only chat, jobs list(see the 1), quote(aka bidding) jobs,3. public profile for the service provider(site.com/profile/company-name)4. web form for customer to submit the job request5. some minor updates at the app side.

1) When creating a “Custom Job Request,” users have the option to include a new service and select it while making the request. To grasp the flow of this process better, you can explore our User App –https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.iqonic.servicebooking&pcampaignid=web_shareHandyman Provider App –https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.iqonic.provider&pcampaignid=web_shareAll providers within the vicinity of the customer will have visibility into the Job Requests.2) The User wallet feature can be hidden via a configuration option available in the admin panel. Admins have the ability to disable it, and any changes made will reflect in the app accordingly.3) Users have access to see provider details.4) Currently, the “Job Request” functionality is exclusively supported within the app. Customization is required for web support, as it’s not inherently available on the web platform.5) Can you share what kind of minor updates you need in app, so we can clarify you if it need customization or not?

responses.message: Hello rami_Hanna,1. Currently, our system’s refund and cancellation process operates based on advance payments. If an advance payment is made for a service, the user will complete the payment online or through their wallet. In the event that the user or provider cancels the booking, the payment for that booking will be transferred back to the user’s wallet. This ensures that the payment is refunded appropriately.2. We do not provide such functionality from admin for cancellation and refund policy as of now. But if you want we have to customize it for you as per your requirements.3. If the provider or customer cancels the order, we refund the amount in wallet. but only in advance payment.Thank you!

message:
Pre-sale questions:
1. Is there an option to have the customer/provider call/video call each other to discuss the project?
2. Is it possible to add tracking to allow the customer to view the live current location of the provider during the scheduled work period to know if they are on their way or still at the work site working similar to how DoorDash lets you see the driver’s location?
3. Is it possible to add a late fee penalty when the provider for example arrives 15 mins late to the job site?
4. Can providers upload videos/images for their portfolio to show proof of their work when making their account and setting up services?
5. Can customers upload videos and images of the job site after the work has been done?
6. Is it possible to completely turn off cash on delivery and set the app to online orders only to receive full payment deposits before the job gets done?
7. I see there is the option to offer remote services but I don’t see anything about using zoom or some video conferencing to deliver the remote service.

responses.message: 1. After a booking is made, you will find an ‘Assign’ button to designate the service provider. If you choose ‘Assign to Myself,’ the provider can then proceed to the service details, where a list of available handymen will be provided. From this list, you can select the handyman who will perform the service.2. If you request customizations, we will keep you updated on the progress of your customization work via Skype.

1. I’m referring to disputes between the customer & the provider. For example if the provider started the job & during the job the customer isn’t pleased and wants to cancel. But they already paid for the job online. How do we handle disputes? Is there no dispute resolution feature? 
2. Im referring to updates you do to the app periodically. If I get a customization from you then update the app – would the customization be overwritten or would you provide a seamless update so as to not overwrite the customizations.

1. We do not currently offer the option to cancel bookings after the service has started or for bookings made through online payment. However, if you require this feature, we can customize your code to implement a cancellation process according to your specifications.2. Please note that periodic updates to the app might overwrite customizations. To prevent this, we can ensure that updates are seamless and do not affect your customizations. We will incorporate your specific requirements into the update process to maintain the integrity of the custom features.

message: PreSale Qs:1. can Admin add fund into user wallet? coz Cannot See user wallet in admin panel!2. Did not see referral system, so user can refer their their friend and earn3. how the admin get paid, if user and seller choose payment after service?4. can we make the customer always pay in advance for all services, to avoid customer and seller cheating us.5. responses.message:
1. Admin has the capability to add funds to a user’s wallet, as illustrated in the screenshot below:
   Link:https://prnt.sc/gj8ewXju81zx 2. Currently, we do not have a referral system in place, but it’s on our roadmap for future updates.3. For cash payments made after service completion, the seller receives the payment, transfers it to the admin, and then the admin reflects the commission in earnings, eventually reimbursing the seller.4. We offer an advance payment option where you can specify the desired advance payment amount for a service when adding it.5. Our system supports online payments for advance payments. All funds are routed to the admin initially, who then disburses payment to the seller post-service completion.6. Yes, users can download invoice from the application.7. The settings allow configuring a service radius, defining the area within which services are offered.

responses.message: You’re showing a screenshot that there’s no error, but it indicates something about migration. The basic concept of migration is that when any changes are made to the same database, for example, adding a column, this command will add it to your database. However, in the last update, there haven’t been any changes related to the database, so it’s showing “nothing to migrate.” I hope now you understand.And regarding the update process, we already have plans to implement automatic updates with just one click. message: Please consider adding the followingLimit by # of Bookings– Add limitation by the number of bookings a provider can get in the subscription plan.Custom Offers– Some services cannot easily be priced without knowing the extent of the work required. Having an option for a client request custom offer and provider giving the price/quotation for the work which a client can accept or decline and be used as the service price for that order/booking. This can be achieved by having a buttonGet a Quotewhere the price is now located or have two buttons one forCustom OfferandBook Nowwhere theBook Nowbutton is located.

responses.message: 1. Okay, thank you for your suggestion.2. So, if I understand correctly, you’re suggesting having two buttons—one for requesting a quote and another for general booking. If a customer selects “quote” they would have the opportunity to determine the price, and once the price is quoted and agreed upon, the service provider would then proceed to provide the service. Is that correct?

2. Yes, two buttons will be available, if a customer selects “quote” they would have the opportunity to provide description of the service/work needs to be done. Based on that description, provider can provide a custom price and the duration of the work. Customer can can then Accept or Decline the offer. If they accept the system will go to the Book Service page for customer to enter details normally with the custom price provided provider as the booking price.This will also work well for those providers who don’t wish write service price, they could leave price option empty or select/enable request a quote option.

@bhoomin2. Presently, the specific functionality you’ve mentioned isn’t incorporated into our project. However, integrating this system is entirely feasible. We’re open to customizing it to suit your needs. If you’re interested in tailoring it to your requirements, please reach out to us via Skype at the contact provided below.Please Contact Us On Skype:https://join.skype.com/invite/yPdnVOwWaqLh

message:
What is the difference between Package List and 
Addon List.

responses.message: In a service package, a provider bundles multiple services together into a single package offering. On the other hand, in an addon list, a service provider includes additional or supplementary services that complement a specific primary service.

message:
Hello 
good product My question is 
1. How does admin collects his commission or subscription from the provider or handyman
2. Is this done autocratically or manually does the system let the provider know what commission to pay after services
3. Is there a maximum commission payment amount to pay to admin rather the provider or handy man will no more have access to services until he settle his payment.
4. is there a payout for handyman is it done equally with flutterwave

responses.message:
Hello RADS5,Thank you for your interest in our product. I’m glad to address your questions:1 & 2. If the user pays online:- Admin receives the full amount.
- Admin deducts their commission.
- Admin pays out the remaining amount to the provider.If the user selects the COD option for payment:- User pays the full amount to the provider.
- Provider pays this amount to the admin.
- Admin deducts their commission and payout amount to provider.
- We automate commission calculation, but admin manually generates payouts. Admin can also payout to banks from the Admin Panel.3. Currently there is no flow that they cannot use any service until a settlement is reached between the provider and the handyman.4. Currently, we do not handle the payout option with flutterwave.Thank you!
thanks

message:
Wonderful app. So must a handyman be under a provider or one can be an independent handyman who can be booked directly? 
When a handyman say moves to a new town, can they change their address to be able to booking from customers in the new area?
How does the admin set their commission is it a fixed figure or a percentage and can it different percentage based on the services categories?

responses.message: 1. Okay, we will fix the spell mistake.2. We offer comprehensive earning settings within the designated section, allowing administrators to configure their preferred earning types. Additionally, we facilitate a payout option for administrators to directly compensate providers. Subsequently, providers manually transfer payments to the designated handyman.3. Admin have the flexibility to set commissions from a predefined provider type list.4. Absolutely, in Cash on Delivery (COD) bookings, the handyman collects the payment from the client and transfers the full amount to the provider. Subsequently, the provider forwards the entire payment to the administrator. After deducting the commission, the administrator disburses the remaining amount to the provider. Payments to the handyman are managed manually.5. We offer a dedicated document section where you can specify the required documents from both providers and handyman.6. To ensure service completion validation, we utilize service images as proof upon service completion.Thank you!

On 4. Thats alot of back and forth transactions, just have the provider get a -ve  balance for commission earned via COD, this should balance out with his existing wallet balance, if the balance is 0 then they get a -ve wallet balance but with a threshold, like they cannot take any more requests if balance is say  -X amount
Thank you for your suggestion. It’s a valuable input for COD booking payments. we will definitely implement it in our application in the future.

message:
Hi:1) Is it possible to use this without the layer of handyman?
in other words, just admin (me), provider, and customers?2) What if customers selected cash on delivery?
How do we bill handymen and providers since we never received the cash?Thank you.

responses.message: Hi maplelife,1. Yes, it is possible to use this product without Handyman. In that case, Provider will have to go and complete the service at the customer’s location.2. When a customer pays for the service using Cash on Delivery (COD), the handyman receives the payment. Subsequently, the handyman manually submits the payment to the service provider, who, in turn, submits the amount to the admin. The admin deducts their commission and then disburses the remaining amount to the service providers. Finally, service providers settle the payment with the handyman directly.Thank you!

message:
Im interested in buying this product but I have a few presale questions:
1. The App has 4 user designations – Admin, Provider, Handyman, User. From what I am seeing, the app is designed for the Provider to create services & assign them to the handyman after approval. What if the provider is the handyman? For example a plumber, would the plumber need to have the service man app installed & the provider app installed then switch between apps to process orders? Is it possible to just disable the handyman feature and have everything run directly as provider? I.e create services, accept bookings, process bookings etc from ONE app?
2. When a User(customer) makes a booking, is it possible to have google maps/ apple makes get their exact location for the order then when they handyman/provider accepts the order they can click to view the address and the maps comes up with directions to the location? (If this isn’t a current feature, what would the custom work for this cost?)

responses.message: Hello Raneybane,1. Absolutely! The booking flow operates seamlessly even without the involvement of a handyman. The provider has the flexibility to assign a service to themselves, eliminating the need for a handyman. Everything can be managed within the provider interface.2. Yes, during the booking process, we retrieve the current location of the user through the map. Currently, we don’t offer a direction feature for the handyman and provider, but it’s already in our roadmap. We’ll be updating it soon.Thank you!

Okay thanks. If I purchase the extended version for 599 what exactly am I getting? Do you install everything for me based on my needs?Also, 1. Is it possible to customize the app to accept full payments from the customer before the provider goes to the address? 
2. How does funds withdrawal work for the provider? Is it a situation where they request withdrawal after the job is marked as completed by the customer or does it go to their specific bank account automatically?
3. Is it possible to implement API for payoneer or other international banks to pay providers locally from any country? If not, what would the customization cost look like.
4. Does this app come with sms notifications already built in? If not what would the customization price be?
5. Finally, for the use of Apple Maps/google maps so provider can see directions to the customer & customer can see where provider is when they are on their way – what would the customization cost be?

Yes, if you purchase extended version, you will get full installation support including Server Setup, Play Store upload, App Store upload.1. Yes, the app can be customized to accept full payments.2. Currently, the real transaction for withdrawal amounts for providers is a manual process; it does not occur automatically.No, the amount does not directly go to the provider’s bank account upon completion. Instead, it is transferred to the provider’s bank account when the admin initiates payouts.3. Yes, customization for this feature is feasible.4. There is no built-in SMS gateway, customization for integrating SMS functionality is possible.5. Yes, achieving this functionality is possible through customization.For customization contact us onhttps://join.skype.com/invite/yPdnVOwWaqLh

message: 1. Hi Sir Do you have Bulk Import / Export of Settings, Categories, Sub-categories, Services iam using another script where i have to export and import here please suggest2. Can i move / reorder / rearrange as per most important services / Categories3. How wallet option works

responses.message: 1) Currently, we do not offer import/export functionality, but we plan to add this feature to our roadmap.2) We do not provide a rearrange or reorder functionality at the moment.3) The wallet operates as follows:- The wallet is functional only when the earning type is set to commission.- The wallet system is designed exclusively for providers and can be enabled in the admin panel under the provider wallet in the provider section.- The admin can manually top up the provider’s wallet upon request.- For instance, if the admin adds $500 to the wallet and the provider has 5 services valued at $150 each, the provider can offer only three services based on the wallet balance (i.e., 150*3 = 450).- If the provider attempts to accept a fourth booking, they will receive an insufficient balance notification. To continue, they must contact the admin to recharge the wallet before further transactions.- Once the admin initiates a payout to the provider with a wallet, the corresponding amount is deducted from the wallet.

message:
Dear @IQonic design, solusmart1 raised 
 extremely valid points and demonstrated the issue by video. Kindly consider adding role-based filtering when the detected role is that of a provider eg (WHERE ProviderID = @ProviderID) as necessary to the relevant commands.You may wish to consider improving the Workflow (by default) to automatically assign the task to a Provider who has not registered any Handyman yet. As it’s expected that any Provider who has handymen would have since registered them before he gets his first booking / order. Because, “There’s no efficient way to do what should NOT be done at all”Kind Regards.

message:
Hi, we want to buy extended license. Please help us with below points: 
Please try to answer as soon as possible as we want to make purchase ASAP.  
1. Role Management: Can we customize the role in system? 
We cannot see role management screen in web 
application. How many type’s roles are available in 
system?
2. Sub – Category Access: We cannot see sub category 
access for any login in system. How is it managed?
3. Does it have analytics for Admin, Vendor and user?
4. Multiple Images: Can we add multiple images for 
category, sub – category and product (services)?
5. –
 How the notification flow works in system?
 If the notification flow is sufficing our 
requirements?
 Can we set the notification templates in system?
 Can admin send notification once product is 
added in system? If the feature available in 
system?

we add multiple country codes?
7: How the product rating flow works in system?

responses.message: Hi,1. Role management is located in the account settings within the admin panel. Please refer to this screenshot:https://prnt.sc/u-TAAORFnYZO.2. The Subcategory tab can be found under services in the admin panel. Please follow this screenshot for reference:https://prnt.sc/z6rOx79VW-xX.3. Yes, the system includes Firebase analytics.4. No, you can choose a single image for this feature.5. Yes, the notification flow works as follows: when a user makes a booking, the service provider for that service is notified. The feature is not available in the current version. We apologise for the inconvenience.7. Reviews and ratings are based on customer-to-service provider interactions. Yes, Razorpay is available in the current system, and you can add bank details for service providers for future payments.9. Mobile OTP integration is available for login and registration.10. Email verification is available.11. The system is SEO-friendly.12. The system can run on any cloud hosting.Thank you!

Dear IQonic Team,There are two major security and usability improvements that could be easily implemented in the next update.SECURITY:
1) An option to enable ONLY verified users post Job Requests. This is helpful as it will definitely protect handymen from kidnap or other security risks if a random unverified user posts a job requesting them to visit insecure places.EASE OF USE

message: What is the relationship between a provider and a handyman?Can a provider have multiple handymen?Who is the actual person who gives the service?Does this mean I will have to setup a provider for me to setup a handyman?If I just want it to have many handymen, no other higher person, does it mean I will be forced to setup providers?

responses.message: Hi tinzane,1. Provider can manage their services. when a Customer book a service, Provider will get a notification. Now, Provider will assign a Handyman to complete the service. Then, Handyman will contact to Customer and go to their place and complete the job.If Provider does not have any Handyman under him or Provider wants to work without Handyman, Provider can assign himself to the Booking and act as a Handyman.2. Yes, Provider can have multiple Handymen.3. Which service you are talking about? Please elaborate.4. No, Its not the necessary to setup provider to setup handyman, because Provider can become handyman him self in booking system for that you need to register all handyman as provider then they can assign them self as handyman.5. You can find answer for this question in the above answer.Thank you!

Home owners, Companies
- These can search for the people above OR post jobs
- They pay via the website/applications, then we pay those who do the jobCan it at least do that?

message: Suppose the customer pays by credit card and the money goes to the admin’s Stripe, how does the provider add his bank account number for the admin to pay him? I don’t see any option to add bank account in the Provider Handyman App. It should have that optionInsist, there should be a way that if the customer pays cash to the Handyman or Service Provider, that he only pays the admin the platform service charges, if it is 10% service fee, he pays that amount and keeps 90%.How can I make it work this way and not get complicated with the providers?

responses.message: 1. In our current system, when user pay for service money goes to admin’s account then admin payout to providers and provider will payout to handyman, but you want the flow as when user pay for service money goes to provider’s account then if it is 10% service fee, he pays that amount to admin and keeps 90%. in order to achieve this flow all provider should have merchant account for online payment gateways like stripe etc and its secret keys and public keys for all developer accounts of provider which is more complicated, even if you want to have payment flow that way we can do customization for you and sorry for our previous reply we forgot to tell you about where you can add bank account of provider you can follow this you will get there in admin in left panel > User > Provider > there you can add bank for provider.2. Whatever bugs in advance payments you found feel free to share with us so we can improve advance payment flow.Thank you!

1. No, I only want the provider to pay the 10% service fee when he receives the payment in cash. What I want to avoid is that if a provider company does an expensive job, and the client pays in cash, that the provider does not need to send all the money to the admin, because that money is his, the ideal option would be to only pay that 10% with credit card, bank transfer or discount in the provider’s wallet in next jobs. I hope you understand me.The way it is for credit card payments is fine, since the admin received the payment from the clients, then he can deduct 10% and pay only 90% to the provider, which is what he is entitled to. I realized that if I put 90% in commission to the supplier it would work the way I want it to.*It would be good that the provider can add his own bank account from the App.
Yes, It is possible and we can do necessary customisation for you.

message:
Hi, I am a bit confused.I need to know how do I set the earning commission for the admin.For example.
If a provider publishes a service in which he charges $100, suppose the commission for the admin is 10% then the provider will get $90.1. If the client paid cash to the provider or handyman, then he received the $100, in this case how will the admin collect the $10 that the provider owes him due to the 10% commission charged by the platform?2. If the customer pays the $100 with credit card via Stripe, in this case the admin is the one who received the $100, how will the admin pay the $90 owed to the provider?3. I would like to know in which section of the admin dashboard, I can configure the % of commission to charge to the providers for each completed service. I have been looking for it but I don’t see where.Please help me.I opened this Ticket #15787

responses.message: Hi roderik27,1. For the Cash payment from the Customer, Provider will pay the full amount, and then Admin will payout to the Providers minus Admin’s commission.2. In this case, Admin will payout to the Providers minus Admin’s commission.3. You can set the commission for the Provider from the provider type section in sidebar.Let us know if you still have any queries.

1. If the Provider receives the cash payment from the customer, I do not see the sense that the Provider pay the full amount to the admin, because if the platform charges 10% for the service to the Providers, ideally the Provider should pay only 10% of the cash received from the customer and keeps the 90% that belongs to him. Don’t you think it’s better this way?2. Perfect.3. Done, I found it. Thanks
1. Yes, you are right. It is the matter of Provider and Admin how they want deal with cash. Cash transactions are not managed in the application so they can manage with your given suggestion.

message:
pre-sale questions:
1- do you have Mercadopago integrated for payment?
2- I would like to provide this platform for free, is it possible?
3- there’s an option that provider can be “provider verified” in the website for a payment?
4- currency can be changed?
5- Translations can be customized?

responses.message: H LaboralArgentina,1. No, We have not yet integrated Mercadopago for payment.2. Yes, It is possible to provide this platform for free. If the goal is for the admin to offer a free platform to providers, the admin can set their commission to zero, allowing providers to earn 100% of their service fees. If both the admin and providers wish to provide a free platform to customers as well, the admin can set their commission to zero, and the service prices for customers can also be set to zero.3. Currently, the option for a “provider verified” status with payment on the website is not available. We can implement this as per your need.4. Yes, the currency can be changed based on your preferences and requirements.5. Yes, translations can be customized to suit your branding and localization needs.Thank you!

message:
Hi
We kindly request your attention to the following proposed app enhancements. We would greatly appreciate it if you could review them and assess the feasibility of incorporating them into the next version:1. Regrettably, the customer, provider, and admin applications lack support for the Spanish language. Currently, language modification is limited to the website admin interface exclusively.2. A crucial feature that is currently absent is the ability to assign distinct commissions for each payment method. Given that payment gateways impose varying commission charges, it is imperative to introduce a differentiation in commission rates between gateway payments and cash transactions.3. We have identified the absence of an option to specify a 0% VAT rate, which is an essential requirement for accurate taxation calculations.4. The inability to modify additional charges poses a significant limitation in accommodating dynamic pricing adjustments.5. A critical aspect missing from the app is the provision for recurring charges, specifically for monthly subscription services offered by providers.6. Furthermore, the app lacks the capability to establish a hybrid commission structure that combines both a percentage-based component and a fixed amount.We eagerly anticipate your evaluation of these proposed corrections and whether they can be seamlessly integrated into the next app version. Your prompt attention to this matter is sincerely appreciated.

responses.message: Hi carogomez8724,Thank you for your valuable suggestion, We will surely try to implement this features in future updates.

message: Dear Iqonic Team,Here’s an important reminder that (whilst exising apps can be updated), new apps sadly are unable to be published because the iOS Team sends the following message.“New Rejection Message from iOS Review Team concerning the Handyman User App (Purchased with my other account)“We found in our review that your app includes user-generated content but does not have all the required precautions. Apps with user-generated content must take specific steps to moderate content and prevent abusive behavior.Specifically, we could not find:- A mechanism for users to flag objectionable content – A mechanism for users to block abusive usersNext StepsTo resolve this issue, please revise your app to implement the following precautions:- Require that users agree to terms (EULA) and these terms must make it clear that there is no tolerance for objectionable content or abusive users – A method for filtering objectionable content – A mechanism for users to flag objectionable content – A mechanism for users to block abusive users – The developer must act on objectionable content reports within 24 hours by removing the content and ejecting the user who provided the offending content””Kindly remember this is a major halting issue that needs to be critically and swiftly addressed. Kind regards.

responses.message: We will look into this issue and try to resolve as soon as possible.Thank you!

As soon as you add services they will be visible on the service list.- Subscription-Based.
The services will be shown only when the Provider had subscribe to one of the plans he had chosen.
So, the service will be added but not shown in the list because non of the Provider has subscribed to the plan, once the Provider will subscribe then it will be shown in the list.2. Yes, so the Provider has the ability to transfer the booking to Handyman or not, again the booking will be done for any one provider.3. We do have Advance payment system, it works like this. 
   – Provider has the ability to choose which service needs the Advance Payment and even they can add the advance payment percentage for the particular service. 
   – Then when user books the service, they will be redirected to the payment screen and they have to pay the advance amount decided by the Provider in the particular services.
   – After payment is done, the Provider will accept the booking and all the process will be same, now when completing the service, at that time the remaining payment amount will be shown and the user have option to pay with cash or online both.Thank You!

message: @f_kael,It appears your suggestion can be addressed by enabling Providers either specify a “Call Out Fee” or “Appointment Fee” or “Consultation Fee” for their service.This implies that Service Providers can indicate for instance that if their fee is ”$200” but either a fixed amount or percentage of that is a “Call Out Fee” (for instance for craftspersons such as Plumbers etc” or an “Appointment Fee” or “Consultation Fee” which is earned the moment the appointment is booked, thus non-refundable.This is helpful because, even in jurisdictions where people may not punitively charge clients for services not-rendered, they agree that if it’s specified as an “Appointment Fee” or “Call Out Fee” it doesn’t sound punitive.In Future the workflow of “Appointment Fees” or “Consultation Fees” can be optimised such that it’s easy to specify that “Appointment Fees” or “Consultation Fees” are Non-Refundable else if the services are NOT rendered by the Service Provider or cancelled perhaps (24hr or 72 hours before the service due date). This aspect of the workflow may also be handled by a client raising a dispute.

I’m thinking of buying this product, which looks good, but it lacks some important features, such as protection against no-shows, i.e. appointments not honored, in the sense that if a customer doesn’t honor an appointment, the supplier should be able to bill him a percentage of the initial amount of the service, something like that, and so on.  What’s more, it seems to me that the customer can’t see how long the service will last.

responses.message: Hello f_kael,We appreciate your valuable input, and we will work towards integrating these features into our system if possible.Customers has the ability to see the time will be taken by the service, in the service detail page.

message:
New Rejection Message from iOS Review Team concerning the Handyman User App (Purchased with my other account)“We found in our review that your app includes user-generated content but does not have all the required precautions. Apps with user-generated content must take specific steps to moderate content and prevent abusive behavior.Specifically, we could not find:- A mechanism for users to flag objectionable content
- A mechanism for users to block abusive usersNext StepsTo resolve this issue, please revise your app to implement the following precautions:- Require that users agree to terms (EULA) and these terms must make it clear that there is no tolerance for objectionable content or abusive users
- A method for filtering objectionable content
- A mechanism for users to flag objectionable content
- A mechanism for users to block abusive users
- The developer must act on objectionable content reports within 24 hours by removing the content and ejecting the user who provided the offending content”It’s my professional opinion that the User Generated Content they mean directly relates to the new “Post Job Request” Feature. Perhaps also Provider Services.

responses.message: Hi dear, as you can check our demo on App Store it is live with all features but still we will look into this matter and update the app with necessary changes.Thank you!

Sure. And that’s because your app is already published, and Updates don’t go through the same stringent Apple store requirements as new apps. Not to mention that Apple keeps adding newer and more strict laws to pre-emptively avoid fines.That said, users who try to publish new apps are certain to run into the same roadblock as listed above. It has been brought to my attention that the provision of Live Chat is also considered an avenue for User Generated Content (UGC) and justifies the requirement for users to be able to block as well as report offensive users to provide a safe space for users of the Apple Store.I am unhappy with their decision, however they are unrelenting and refusing to budge in spite of an appeal requesting they allow the app whilst the features are being implemented. Thus we are unable to make any progress till this feature comes live.Kindly accord it the priority it deserves. Even if the next update can have a mild version of the features. That will be great.
Yes, I agree with you, they keep changing their update policies.

message: Have tried out the app but i don’t see the option for provider to request payout, can you explain to me how payment process works in this system, How do payout work because  this is the most important part, why is it that provider need s to have money in the wallet to accept booking , I thought since its commission based admin will get commission after the payment of service is done?

responses.message: Hello ReviewReeves,Currently, we do not have a built-in payout request option in our app or web platform. Instead, Providers need to manually request payouts from an Admin. The payout system operates in the following manner:1. When a payment is made, it initially goes to the Admin.2. Providers can request a payout from the Admin, who will then process the payment to the Provider.3. Once the Provider receives the payment, they are responsible for paying the corresponding amount to the handyman.Please note that this process requires manual intervention from the Admin to facilitate the payout between the Provider and the handyman.
have tested the provider app but i did not see option for provider to request payout
As we mentioned before we haven’t provide option for provider to request payout from application.

message: Hello Developers,Could you kindly explain how the subscription model works? I reviewed your demo panel but didn’t quite grasp the concept.

responses.message: Hi jigs1999,This is the earning type for the Provider.Commission Based, As soon as you add services they will be visible on the service list and Customers can book the services.Subscription Based, Every Provider will have to subscribe to any one plan available to buy. Now, the Customer can see only those Provider’s services who have subscribed to any one plan. That is the subscription method.
I have one more query that how Provider will subscribe to the plan ? does admin will create those plan ? if yes, then from where admin can create plans ?

Subscription for provider works as follow,1. Firstly you have to change the earning type of the system to subscription, you can change it from admin panel -> settings -> earning type -> choose subscription.2. By changing this option you will the Plan option in the admin side bar, from there you can able to add the plan as per your requirement.Note: After changing the option to subscription, no services will be shown to user, the user will see the services of those who have subscribe to the system.3. Now, in the provider application, you will get the buy now option in dashboard. On click of that provider will able to see the plans you have added from admin panel.4. Now, provider will choose the desired plans and will buy the plan, and expiry date for the plan and all will be listed in the profile section. And yes when the plan is about to expire 7 days before they will get renew option on dashboard.So this way the Subscription system will work.
