message:
Hello,Here are some suggestions for the App:1) Does the App provide an OTP or confirmation when the Providor arrives. This is more of security feature to ensure it’s not a stranger
2) Apple Logins/OTP Login. With OTP logins, it should showcase newly registered users on the dashboard
3) After a booking is complete, their should be a pop-up to urge customers to provide a review
4) There should also be a live tracker/location of when the providor is nearby
5) A subscription/repeat service module, for example if someone uses a service regularly then a subscription will be important.

Thank you for the suggestion, We will try this to implement.4. We will add this into our list and if possible we will implement and provide an update.5. We currently don’t have any plan to add user subcriptions, but if you want we provide paid service, in which we will help you to add the user subcriptions.Thanks

2. If someone registers as a new user, it should give us the option to call them and discuss with the,
3. Excellent
5. I can see this feature has been recommended perhaps like a few times as other scripts are using this including Qixer and another script here. There should be a subscription option for customers to have this subscription for a weekly/bi-weekly service.Thanks
2. So we do provide the phone number on web, you can directly call the provider and get information and if provider is verified you can simply accept the request.5. We will re-think about it.Thanks!

message:
Hello, we want to buy this product, but we have some questions.1. How to benefit from the site after Handymay Provider cash payment?

3. How is the amount paid through the card (Provider) paid after the order is executed by Handymay? (That is, how does he get paid for the service he provides to the Provider. I found this part unclear) Can you enable this for us? We’ve seen in some comment threads that you can do this.

We have not provided the payment request from the application.4. Its because if some of the provider wants the wallet system, and some don’t then they will not create a wallet.5. Customer cannot increase wallet amount as of now. Customer can use wallet only for getting refund for cancelled services.

message:
Hello, we have been testing this program since last year.thedygoncalves
1. The opinions reported by the user completely coincide with ours. We noticed that during the test, the notification does not appear on the screen as soon as the payments are made. For example, a notification appears on the phone screen as soon as an sms is written in the Umatsapp application. But this is not the case in your app. It doesn’t work at all.2. Provider and Handyman side
There is some involvement in Buddha. Example: How can an electrician register himself, accept and execute orders. It must be related to some company. This is not in accordance with the principle of work. That is, the persons who perform it are said to be in the interest of it. All you need is an executable app.3. It would be better if a basic issue is added in the app. Currently, all work is done at the address of the person who ordered. If there is a small change, on the address selection page, the user should enter the address of the person performing the work, not his own. So these salons are spa salons etc. will assist in booking their services.tamsir 
4. And finally, pages in apps load very slowly. How we tested it has nothing to do with internet speed.

responses.message: Hi asbirja,1. We have not provided the support for Pop up notifications in the applications, we have only provided support for Push Notifications.2. Yes, so in our case, The company can be the Provider and electrician(i.e) Handyman can be registered under the Company/provider. if some of the providers need to manually perform the service as their personal interest to it, they can choose the them shelf booking option.3. Thank you for the suggestion, we will add this into our list.4. we are continuously updating the API response and we will optimize them.

message: What is the difference between user, provider and service man

responses.message: Hello,User/Customer can see services in the app, and Book any service and get the job done at home.Provider can manage their services. when a Customer book a service, Provider will get a notification. Now, Provider will assign a Handyman to complete the service. Then, Handyman will contact to Customer and go to their place and complete the job.If Provider does not have any Handyman under him or Provider wants to work without Handyman, Provider can assign himself to the Booking and act as a Handyman.Don’t hesitate to ask any other question.Thank you

We still haven’t launched because investors simply ask, walk us through the workflow, and once they see NOBODY can withdraw, the statement is … beautiful app but not ready for primetime.Can you please just add 4 fields, and update, you can always update the featuresets later. Thank you for your suggestions.

message:
1. Can this system be deployed as just a web app and later deploy the mobile apps ?2. Not understanding the distinction between a provider and a handyman. It the provider more.or less the admin or moderator?3. How are commissions paid out? Does the admin just issue payments to the handymen manually outside of the system?4. Can the handyman and provider t
Roles be combined in the event that there is no middle man? Can this system be deployed functionally for a single man operation ?5. How much does implementation cost for just the complete web application and excluding the mobile app?6. Can sub categories be disable so that just categories and services are listed w out need to select a sub category?7. Can the admin change icons and service thumbnail images from the Laravel admin app?8. If you use the option to assign the provider to the job, essentially eliminating the handyman role…will each service still display the provider? This seems unnecessary if the provider is the one carrying out all services.9. Is it possible to request credit card information at time of booking but process payment after work has been performed?10. Possible to integrate twilio for sms notifications?11. If a user requests a custom project bid…is there an established workflow in the system or does it become a manual process ? For example…can the admin review the custom request and then create a custom offer so the project and payment can be handled through the application.

responses.message: Hello RobbyRicigliano,1 No, the Flutter code doesn’t have support for the web.2 Provider is the one in which the multiple Handyman will work and those work are assigned by the Provider.3 Commission is for the Admin, the Admin will register the new Provider on the base of Fixed or Percentage based commission, now when the on service is being completed then the whole amount will be credited to the Admin’s account, then Provider will ask for the payout and the payout amount will be transferred to the respective Provider manually.4 Yes, if you don’t want a Handyman then you can assign the service to yourself we have provided this option.5 So you want the Flutter application to work on the web?6 Yes, subcategory is the optional field only, so if you don’t want to add the subcategory, then too flow will work fine.7 Yes, each and every images in the applications and Web can be customised or change.8 Yes, we have not hide that option, but if you want we can help you with that.9 Yes, it is possible but you have to customize the flow, we can help you but you have to buy our paid support.10 Yes, we will try our best to integrate it.11 No, there is no such verification process.

message:
I don’t get how to commission system work,
When you open wallet history screen, it show top-up your wallet but there is no option to top-up.

responses.message: Hello,Commission flow works something like this, Admin can set the commission for the Provider on the basis of provider type, now once the Service is booked and after completion of the Service the amount will be credited to the Admin account and then it will be payout to the Provider.The wallet topup is only done by Admin on request from Provider.Yes, we are missing this feature of adding bank detail, but we have this in our plan and we are going to start work on this very soon.

In the admin panel there is no option to set the commission.
Currently how is the provider cashing out his earnings?(during online payment gateway)
Is the admin manually sending transactions?
And are you planning to implement the option for the provider to cash out his earnings directly by himself without the admin indulgence

Hello,Under the provider section, there is an option for provider type and in that you can set commission based on type, In case of online payment the amount will be credited to the admin account and then the admin will payout to the provider on demand of the amount requested by the provider, yes admin will send the amount manually, yes for the cash flow we are planning the whole system for all roles.

message:
Hi, We want to by Handyman but before that we have some questions we want to have answered before buying:- Does the code integrate unit tests?
- Can we modify the user interface of the website with a Wordpress Builder? If yes, can you tell us with which builder? If not can we modify the style of the web interface with the source code (which programming language?)

responses.message: -Is the front end of the application linked to the front end of the WEB version: Will a change of color on the mobile application have an impact on the web interface?- Is it possible to make a subscription system linked to conmission (for example if the customer chooses subscription 1 a commission of 10% is applied, if he chooses subscription 2 a commission of 20% is applied) ?- We found that the customer sees the services according to their geolocation. But we don’t know how far away the services are located? Can the customer choose to put a city to filter the services instead of doing it by his geolocation?-  Can payment be made at the time of booking and not at the end of the service?

1 No, we have not written unit test code.2 Yes, you can modify the style, but we have not used any WordPress Builder as  the whole system is developed with the Laravel and VueJs technologies. The frontend website for user is developed with VueJs and Admin Panel with the Laravel.3 No, the mobile application and web interface runs separately, If you have changed the color in mobile application then it will only impact the mobile application interface only.4 Yes, it is possible, but you have to customise the code as per the requirement, for this you can do it by yourself or you can hire us to do this with our paid support.5 Customer can’t put the location directly, but Admin has the option to select the radius of which customer can see the services around (e.g. admin has set 200km from backend, then the customer see the services within the 200km radius from their current location.6 Yes, it is possible, but you have to do it by yourself or you can hire us to do that.

message:
Hello, I would like to ask you to please consider the following features for your next update:
1. The payment can also be made at the time of starting the service and not only at the end (This to avoid that the work is done and the customer does not pay).
2. The price of the service can be adjusted (it happens a lot that when the work is evaluated, the price can increase or decrease).
3. That the services can be published with fixed price ranges.Thank you very much

responses.message: 1 & 3 is possible but it needs customization.2 This functionality already exists with Extra Charge feature.

message: I got one more question. I spend lots of time in admin area but something doesn’t add up. where can I locate the balance for every provider ? also the assumption the app collect payment in credit and pay provider but since cash on delivery is an option with that option alone provider will collect the money not the opposite. how can an admin know how much each provider owe to collect. Last question how can provider also know how much each handyman collected from customers ?

responses.message:
Admin can see the earning for the provider from the earning tab in dashboard same as for handyman from handyman earning tab.
Now, our flow is like, admin can pay manually to each provider based on the commission of provider and after that provider pay their handyman based on commission.

So I understand the logic but my question how does this work in cash on delivery payment option ? Because admin will not be able to collect nor provider, instead handyman will collect from customer when deliver the service  and should pay provider and then provider should pay admin. Will the app not work under that model ? Also does that mean cash on delivery can’t be the only method in the app ? Thank you
Hello,Currently, we don’t have any proper way in the system to manage the cash on delivery, but we have started working on this flow. Any suggestion would be a great help by you. Thank you

message: Hi. I am interested on buying this product but I am a little bit skeptical about the process. In your screenshot says that the provider need to accept or decline and then must also the handyman accept or decline. What this means? The provider is an agency7company which has works and then the works have they also an account under their agency? This is complicated. I f I have my company then I just send works to do the work, not wait them to accept or not. How many accounts need then to register in this app? 1 account for buyer, 1 account for agency, and 1 account for worker?

responses.message:
Hi,Let say you are a Provider. Now, when a Customer book a service, You can assign a Handyman to do the job or you can assign your self immediately.Accept or Decline comes in the picture, when your assigned Handyman is not able to do the job at the moment for some reason, so he will decline the request and then you as Provider will be able to assign another Handyman or yourself for that Booking.Below accounts are need.
Provider, Handyman, Customer.Note: Provider can act as a Handyman if they want to work alone.
Can the handyman work alone without under a provider? Can he register his account and start working? Or he needs to create an account only under a provider?

Yes, Handyman needs a Provider to work.
Hence, Provider can work without Handyman as a freelancer.

message: While you are working on Job Request feature, can you please consider Reverse Bidding feature as well? Providers/handyman can bid on job and customer can select cheapest bidder to do the job.

responses.message: Yes, Our flow is like, The multiple providers can bid on the service and the user will accept one of them which is best suitable for them.This process is for one time.
Sounds good. Will providers within a radius also receive a notification of new jobs?
When new jobs are created, all providers will be notified.

message: I am not sure if I understand your workflow correctly. It’s seems very confusing to me and probably my potential users.Handyman needs Providers to assign work to them otherwise they cannot work. Okay, sooo WHY DO WE HAVE HANDYMAN REGISTER and just sit there? Apparently waiting to assigned by admin to a Provider they don’t know?I don’t see the logic of all this. It’s very confusing, especially to someone who wants to signup. How and where do I even explain that to them? there is no where to give users a heads up on the difference between Provider and Handyman before they register, no option to request account type change either. I mean, you just assume people registering on the app will automatically understand this?Then admin has to spend hours assigning Handyman to Providers manually not knowing whether the Provider even need or want another Handyman. Admin is basically force a Handyman unto the Provider? And also admin decides the commission the Provider is to pay that Handyman? How does that make sense?At the very least, you could add a new page where Providers can see the list of unassigned Handyman and choose the ones they want by themselves removing a load of work to admin or just remove Handyman registration and let them just sign in after added by Provider.I don’t know, maybe I don’t understand the reason behind all this, or maybe you have plans in the future that will add more sense to your flow. Anyway, an explanation would be helpful.

responses.message: Hi, Let me explain you about What is the difference between Provider and Handyman?Provider can manage their services. when a Customer book a service, Provider will get a notification. Now, Provider will assign a Handyman to complete the service. Then, Handyman will contact to Customer and go to their place and complete the job.If Provider does not have any Handyman under him or Provider wants to work without Handyman, Provider can assign himself to the Booking and act as a Handyman.About Unassigned Handyman List, You can see the list of Unassigned Handymans in Pending Handyman List from the Left Side Bar.If you want to change the flow of the system, you can change as per your requirements once you buy the code from codecanyon or you can hire us for customization.Thank You

message: 1. While customer booking for a service in the booking detail he is seeing $100 (let us say). Is this $100 hourly rate of the handyman?. In that case, if service completed in 30 min, the expectation is that customer should pay $30?2. If handyman spends more than 90min, system will customer to pay $150?3. Is fixed and hourly both supported ?4. In case of ‘Fixed’, assuming that 1 hour service for  $100. If service completed 30min, system will as customer to pay $50 or $100? if service competes in 90min, will system asks customer to pay $150 or $100?5. In case of Fixed (let is say 1 hour service for $100), does system store expected start and end dates for the service (1 hour apart) ?

responses.message: 1, 2 & 4. If Handyman takes 1 hour to complete the service, customer will have to pay $100. If service completes in 30 min, still customer will have to pay $100 but if Handyman takes 2 hours to complete the service, customer will have to pay $200 as per our flow.3. Yes, Both supported.5. Yes, it stores but doesn’t calculate price based on the time in case of fixed service.
Thank you

message: I would like to purchase your service soon, I would like to know if one handyman request for a job from a provider for a 4 hours of work, but work completed after 5 hours, in this case is there any option to update task cost and details to 5 hours before he finish job?In short, is it possible for provider to update any details after he accept works?

responses.message: In our product flow, Handyman does not request for a job. Customer can book a service and Provider will approve and assign himself or any Handyman and then assigned person will go to the service location and complete the job.If your service hours is not fixed, you can add hourly service. So based on hours of work, the cost will imply.

I understood the flow of this app, but what I am asking is in most cases weather it’s hourly or fixed , once handyman started working there may be additional hours or additional tasks that he may provide to whom the work is booked, 
In this case handyman or admin can add/edit tasks ?For eg, I requested for 2 car wash, once handyman enter to my home I have one more bike that also required to wash
Or, I requested 4 hours of carpenter work, but work went to 8 hours to complete, in these cases handyman, provider or admin can edit tasks?If this feature is not available, I think it will be a good feature for on demand service appsThank you
No, it is not available as of now. We will add in the upcoming updates.Thank you

message: Hi. I have some pre-sale questions after using your demo app:1. Can I modify a language file in code? I think app using automated translation language so many words are meaningless in my language/country.2. I don’t see Chat button in any provider pages, so how to chat with provider?3. In user app, I don’t see button to buy a membership package to become a provider. Where is it? Or how can I register as provider?4. Can I remove/disable/hide some sections in service page like Duration, Service available in this city…5. Can I remove/disable/hide booking function? I want users to see service’s information only, and they can chat or call provider to discuss more.6. Can I add country/state manually?7. How can user/provider delete his account permanently as Apple account deletion policy?8. Will you make register/login function by OTP using Firebase in the future?Thank you.

responses.message: 1) Yes, you can modify the language from the code in Apps.2) As per our flow, User can’t chat with the Provider only chat with the Handyman.3) You can register provider as from the app and also admin can manage the provider. if admin set the earning type of provider as a subscription then only the membership package are show to the provider dashboard.4) es, you can remove/disable/hide from the code in Apps5) Yes, you can remove/disable/hide from the code in Apps but User can’t chat with the Provider only chat with the Handyman.6) Yes, you can add country/state manually from the database.7) From the apps we do not provide to delete account, but admin can delete the user or provider permanently.Only user can register/login with OTP.

message: Hello,I’ve recently bought the Handyman Service solution, but I’m having difficulties getting it up and running. The documentation is useful, but not everything is detailed.I’d like to know how the two databases (Mysql & Firebase) communicate with each other and how to configure them. Is Firebase used only for authentication? Where does the data get stored? When I change something in the admin panel, is the change going to be effective in the app? (Knowing that the app uses Firebase and the admin panel uses Mysql).Thank you in advance.

responses.message:
Hi, Firebase is used for only chat between users and handymans, rest data is stored in MySQL.When I change something in the admin panel, is the change going to be effective in the app?
- Yes.

message:
Presale question
1. On the latest update, there is a Dynamic Subscription Plan – What does that means exactly?2. Is it possible to disable a particular payment gateway for Customer payment but still use it for Provider Subscription?3. Can a provider also be a handyman?Thank you.

responses.message: 1. It means, now you can manage subscription plans from Admin panel. Till now, the Plans was statically predefined.2. No, both payment gateways are synced. If you are disabling for Customer, it will be disabled for Provider also. But you can change it by little customization.3. For now, Provider and Handyman are different roles in our Flow, but still, you can customize it into one roleThank you.
